inputEx.YQL.name: inputEx.YQL

params.name: codeStr
params.description: YQL-execute javascript code

params.name: callback
params.description: Callback function

queryCode.description: Dynamically build a XML from javascript code and generate a dummy request for YQL

params.name: additionalCallbacks
params.description: List of [list of callbacks] (each yql query can call multiple callbacks)

initTrimpathPage.description:
YQL-trimpath-page is a utility to create pages using YQL queries ant Trimpath templating
All YQL queries are made using the rpc/yql.js utility.
see examples/yql-trimpath-page.html
Call this method on page load to run yql queries and the associated templates

params.name: callbacks
params.description: Array of (list of callbacks functions) (provide a list of callbacks for each script type="text/yql" tag in the page)

init.description:
Run script type="text/yql" tags on YQL servers
If you have just one script tag and one callback, pass [[function(results) {}]]
If you have two script tags and two callback for each: [ [function() {},function() {}] , [function() {},function() {}]]
etc...

params.name: codeUrl
params.description: Url to a YQL-execute javascript file

params.name: callback
params.description: Callback function

queryUrl.description: Dynamically build a XML from a URL and generate a dummy request for YQL

params.name: yql
params.description: YQL query string

params.name: callback
params.description: Callback function

query.description: Generate the jsonp request to YQL

genTrimpathCallback.description: Build a callback that runs a trimpath template (used by initTrimpathPage)

inputEx.YQL.description:
inputEx YQL utility

Provide functions to run YQL javascript code and get results asynchronously.

YQL Execute is only available from a YQL request using a YQL Open Table XML file. This script uses a php (http://javascript.neyric.com/yql/js.php) to generate the wanted XML file from javascript code.

Examples:

  • http://javascript.neyric.com/yql/js.php?url=http://gist.github.com/106503.txt
  • http://javascript.neyric.com/yql/js.php?code=...jscode...

We use a classic JSONP hack to get the results via a callback method.

inputEx.MapField.name: inputEx.MapField

params.name: options
params.description:
Added options:
  • width
  • height
  • loading
  • lat
  • lon
  • uzoom
  • api: google, yahoo or virtualearth (default)
  • api_key

constructors.description: Wrapper for Mapping APIs, including Google Maps, Yahoo Maps and Virtual Earth

preload.description:
This preloaded MAY not really work -- we recommend that you use
the following JavaScript instead _after_ "yahoo-dom-event.js" (or similar)
is included:
script type="text/javascript"
YMAPPID = [yourapikey]
/script
script type="text/javascript" src="http://us.js2.yimg.com/us.js.yimg.com/lib/map/js/api/ymapapi_3_8_0_7.js"
/script
Note the non-standard loading pattern! See:
http://yuiblog.com/blog/2006/12/14/maps-plus-yui/

wait_create.description: This will wait until the DOM element appears before completion of map rendering

setValue.description: set the value: {lat: 45.23234, lon: 2.34456, uzoom: 6, nzoom: 6}

getValue.description: return the same structure as setValue

Object} config An object targeting the choice to remove (e.g. { position : 1 } || { value: 'second' } || { label: 'Second'

  • parentEl: DOMelement in which we have to insert the datatable
  • datasource (or datasourceConfig)
  • datatableOpts: additionnal datatable options
  • fields: inputEx fields
  • dialogLabel: title of the dialog
  • columnDefs: YUI datatable columnDefs
  • id: (optional, default is autogenerated) sets the id of the div wrapper around the widget
  • allowInsert: adds the 'Insert' button (optional, default true)
  • allowModify: default true
  • allowDelete: default true
  • showHideColumnsDlg: add a link to a dialog to show/hide columns
  • panelConfig: (optional) YUI's dialog panelConfig object

inputEx.Field.name: inputEx.Field

params.name: options

Configuration object
  • name: the name of the field
  • required: boolean, the field cannot be null if true
  • className: CSS class name for the div wrapper (default 'inputEx-Field')
  • value: initial value
  • parentEl: HTMLElement or String id, append the field to this DOM element

constructors.description: An abstract class (never instantiated) that contains the shared features for all fields.

options.description: Configuration object to set the options for this class and the parent classes. See constructor details for options added by this class.

render.description: Default render of the dom element. Create a divEl that wraps the field.

setClassFromState.description: Set the styles for valid/invalide state

return.description: One of the following states: 'empty', 'required', 'valid' or 'invalid'

getState.description: Returns the current state (given its value)

close.description: Close the field and eventually opened popups...

getStateString.description: Get the string for the given state

renderComponent.description: Render the interface component into this.divEl

getEl.description: The default render creates a div to put in the messages

destroy.description: Purge all event listeners and remove the component from the dom

inputEx.ListField.name: inputEx.ListField

params.name: options
params.description:
Added options:
  • sortable: Add arrows to sort the items if true (default false)
  • elementType: an element type definition (default is )
  • useButtons: use buttons instead of links (default false)
  • unique: require values to be unique (default false)
  • listAddLabel: if useButtons is false, text to add an item
  • listRemoveLabel: if useButtons is false, text to remove an item
  • maxItems: maximum number of items (leave undefined if no maximum, default)
  • minItems: minimum number of items to validate (leave undefined if no minimum, default)

inputEx.JsonSchema.name: inputEx.JsonSchema

inputExToSchema.description: Convert the inputEx JSON fields to a JSON schema

inputEx.JsonSchema.description:
Namespace containing utility functions for conversion between inputEx JSON format and JSON Schema
based on "Json Schema Proposal Working Draft":
http://groups.google.com/group/json-schema/web/json-schema-proposal-working-draft
The proposal is still under discussion and the implementation is very minimalist.
TODO:
- we should provide a lot of json schema examples and instances that should/should not validate
- use the $ref (async calls => provide callbacks to methods)
- Inheritance
Limitations:
- ??? Please do not trust inputEx: the getValue may return a value which do NOT validate the schema (provide an example ?)
- no tuple typing for arrays
- no "Union type definition"

params.name: options
params.description:
inputEx.Field options object
  • confirmPasswordField: the PasswordField instance to compare to when using 2 password fields for password creation (please use the setConfirmationField method)
  • strengthIndicator: display a widget to indicate password strength (default false)
  • capsLockWarning: display a warning if CapsLock is on (default false)
  • confirm: id of the field to compare to

constructors.description: Create a password field.

params.name: passwordField
params.description: The target password field

setConfirmationField.description: Set this field as the confirmation for the targeted password field:

params.name: e
params.description: The original input event

onInput.description: Update the state of the confirmation field

updateStrengthIndicator.description: Update the strength indicator (called by onKeyPress)

renderComponent.description: Set the el type to 'password'

params.name: options
params.description: Options object as passed to the constructor

setOptions.description: Add the password regexp, strengthIndicator, capsLockWarning

setCapsLockWarning.description: Show or hide the caps lock warning given the status

onKeyUp.description: onkeyup callback to update the strength indicator

getPasswordStrength.description:
Return an integer within [0,100] that quantify the password strength
Function taken from Mozilla Code: (changed a little bit the values)
http://lxr.mozilla.org/seamonkey/source/security/manager/pki/resources/content/password.js

validate.description: The validation adds the confirmation password field support

byId.description: Keep track of all instances, indexed by ids, for the password confirmation field

Tweaking the TimeField to make a Time Range (two TimeFields)

Disable the last selector and set it to "00" when the third one's value is 24

  • size: size attribute of the input
  • maxLength: maximum size of the string field (no message display, uses the maxlength html attribute)
  • minLength: minimum size of the string field (will display an error message if shorter)
  • typeInvite: string displayed when the field is empty
  • readonly: set the field as readonly

params.type: Object} domAttributes An object containing key/value pairs to set as node attributes (ex: {id: 'myElement', className: 'myCssClass', ...

params.description: Same thing for style attributes. Please use camelCase for style attributes (ex: backgroundColor for 'background-color')

removeAccents.description: Return a string without accent (only on lowercase)

params.name: str
params.description: The string

params.name: type
params.description: String type of the field

getFieldClass.description:
Returns the class for the given type
ex: inputEx.getFieldClass("color") returns inputEx.ColorField

typeClasses.description:
Hash between inputEx types and classes (ex: inputEx.typeClasses.color = inputEx.ColorField)
Please register the types with the registerType method

regexps.description: Associative array containing common regular expressions

browserAutocomplete.description:
Property to globally turn on/off the browser autocompletion
(used as default autocomplete option value by StringField, Form and their subclasses)

spacerUrl.description: Url to the spacer image. This url schould be changed according to your project directories

inputEx.description:
The inputEx method lets you create a field from the JSON definition: 
inputEx({type: 'string', name: 'company', label: 'Your company' })
Build a field from an object like: { type: 'color' or fieldClass: inputEx.ColorField, ... }
If the neither type or fieldClass are found, it uses inputEx.StringField

params.name: options
params.description:
The following options are available for Button :
  • id: id of the created A element (default is auto-generated)
  • className: CSS class added to the button (default is either "inputEx-Button-Link" or "inputEx-Button-Submit-Link", depending on "type")
  • parentEl: The DOM element where we should append the button
  • type: "link", "submit-link" or "submit"
  • value: text displayed inside the button
  • disabled: Disable the button after creation
  • onClick: Custom click event handler

constructors.description: Create a button

params.name: parentEl
params.description: The DOM element where the button should be rendered

render.description: render the button into the parent Element

initEvents.description: attach the listeners on "click" event and create the custom events

setOptions.description: set the default options

destroy.description: Purge all event listeners and remove the component from the dom
